title: Understanding Refeeding Syndrome
text: Refeeding syndrome is a serious condition that can occur when feeding is reintroduced to a malnourished person. It involves rapid changes in fluid and electrolyte balance.

title: Symptoms of Refeeding Syndrome
text: Symptoms can include cardiac arrhythmias, delirium, and even coma. It's important to monitor these symptoms closely.

hintAnswer: for malnourished clients, rapid changes in their fluid volume and electrolytes cause complications like cardiac arrhythmias, delirium, coma, and even death
title: Identifying the Correct Definition
text: Which of the following best describes refeeding syndrome?
choices: for malnourished clients, rapid changes in their fluid volume and electrolytes cause complications like cardiac arrhythmias, delirium, coma, and even death
a system of refeeding slowly, beginning with fluids
a system of refeeding slowly, beginning with solid foods
